Class TaskTransferFunction_

  • java.lang.Object
    • TaskTransferFunction_
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

    public class TaskTransferFunction_
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
    ImageJ plugin to calculate the task transfer function (TTF) of a circular object present in an image. The routine will run on a user-selected region of interest (ROI). If no ROI is selected then the routine exits.

    The main steps of the routine are:
    • Set the centre of mass of the object to the centre of the ROI
    • If the user has chosen to find the centre of the object:
      • Calculate background using an annular ROI 2 pixels wide positioned outside the main ROI
      • Use template matching to find the centre of the circular object in a background-subtracted copy of the main ROI
      • Reposition the main ROI using the object centre determined above
      • Calculate the centre of mass using an ROI that is 4 pixels wider than the specified object diameter
    • Centre the main ROI on the object centre of mass
    • Calculate contrast-to-noise ratio using a circular ROI with a diameter 50 % of the object diameter and an annular background ROI with inner and outer diameters of 150 and 200 % of the object diameter
    • Construct an edge spread function (ESF) from the value of each pixel in a circular ROI twice the diameter of the object vs. its distance from the object centre of mass
    • Differentiate the ESF to obtain the line spread function (LSF)
    • Fourier transform the LSF to obtain the TTF

      • templateMatch

        private static double[] templateMatch(ij.ImagePlus image,
                                      ij.ImagePlus template,
                                      double image_bgd,
                                      boolean show_corr_map)
        A method to find the location of a feature within an image that matches a supplied template. The method finds the location by moving the template over the image in a raster fashion. At each template location the sum of the absolute value of each template pixel value multiplied by the corresponding image pixel value is found. The template position with the highest sum is considered to be the best match for the location of a feature that matches the template. The returned coordinates correspond to the top left-hand corner of the best template location.
        Parameters:
        image - The image in which to search for the template
        template - The template
        image_bgd - The mean background of the image
        show_corr_map - Switch to determine if a map of the calculated correlation values is shown
        Returns:
        A two-element array containing x, y locations of the top left-hand corner of the best template match

      • createBinaryDiscTemplate

        private static ij.ImagePlus createBinaryDiscTemplate(double disc_diameter_in_mm,
                                                     double pixel_size_in_mm,
                                                     ij.measure.Calibration cal)
        Method to create a binary template representing a disc of a specified diameter. The boundaries of the disc are not well-defined when using this method.
        Parameters:
        disc_diameter_in_mm - The diameter of the disc in mm
        pixel_size_in_mm - The pixel size in mm
        cal - The Calibration to apply to the template
        Returns:
        The disc template

      • createDiscTemplate

        public static ij.ImagePlus createDiscTemplate(double disc_diameter_in_mm,
                                              double pixel_size_in_mm,
                                              ij.measure.Calibration cal)
        Method to create a template representing a disc of a specified diameter. This method creates a super-sampled template to begin with and then resamples it to the required size. This super-sampling results in improved definition of the object boundaries.
        Parameters:
        disc_diameter_in_mm - The diameter of the disc in mm
        pixel_size_in_mm - The pixel size in mm
        cal - The Calibration to apply to the template
        Returns:
        The disc template
